member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataPriority
member.summary: Specifies the relative importance of an app capture metadata item stored using AppCaptureMetadataWriter. When the storage space allotted for accumulated metadata is low, the system will use the priority and age of metadata items to determine the order in which metadata is purged to free storage space.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataPriority.Important
member.summary: The metadata item is of higher importance than **Informational** metadata items.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataPriority.Informational
member.summary: The metadata item is of lower importance than **Important** metadata items.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataWriter
member.summary: Enables an app to store metadata that the system will insert into captured video files or broadcast streams of app content.

member.name: M:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataWriter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the **AppCaptureMetadataWriter** class.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataWriter.RemainingStorageBytesAvailable
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes remaining in the storage space allocated by the system for app capture metadata items.
member.returns: The number of bytes remaining for metadata storage.

member.name: E:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataWriter.MetadataPurged
member.summary: Occurs when the system purges previously stored metadata items.

member.name: M:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataWriter.AddDoubleEvent(System.String,System.Double,Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataPriority)
member.summary: Adds a new double metadata event.
member.param: The name of the metadata event.
The value of the metadata event.

A member of the AppCaptureMetadataPriority enumeration specifying the relative importance of the metadata item. This value and the age of a metadata item are used by the system to determine which metadata items should be purged first when the limit of the allocated storage space for accumulated metadata is reached.

member.name: M:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataWriter.AddInt32Event(System.String,System.Int32,Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataPriority)
member.summary: Adds a new integer metadata event.
member.param: The name of the metadata event.
The value of the metadata event.

A member of the AppCaptureMetadataPriority enumeration specifying the relative importance of the metadata item. This value and the age of a metadata item are used by the system to determine which metadata items should be purged first when the limit of the allocated storage space for accumulated metadata is reached.

member.summary: Adds a new string metadata event.
member.param: The name of the metadata event.

A member of the AppCaptureMetadataPriority enumeration specifying the relative importance of the metadata item. This value and the age of a metadata item are used by the system to determine which metadata items should be purged first when the limit of the allocated storage space for accumulated metadata is reached.

member.name: M:Windows.Media.Capture.AppCaptureMetadataWriter.Close
member.summary: Disposes of the object and associated resources.

member.summary: Stops the metadata state with the specified identifier.
member.param: The identifier of the state to be stopped.
